content.body: hi folks, trying to get some clarity on `"numeric"` format for `hour`, `minute`, and `second` in `DateTimeFormat`: is that supposed to be 1-digit or 2-digit?
content.formatted_body: hi folks, trying to get some clarity on "numeric" format for hour, minute, and second in DateTimeFormat: is that supposed to be 1-digit or 2-digit?

content.body: was there a recent normative change in the spec that made `"numeric"` one (1) digit and `"2-digit"` two (2) digits?
content.formatted_body: was there a recent normative change in the spec that made "numeric" one (1) digit and "2-digit" two (2) digits?

content.body:
i'll ask it a different way, i have some urgency here. by my reading `"numeric"` is specced to mean one (1) digit in ecma402

- is this a recent change? if so, what's the PR? i couldn't find it.
- is this how it's always been? if so, how come all the browsers (and MDN) format `"numeric"` as two (2) digits?
content.formatted_body:
i'll ask it a different way, i have some urgency here. by my reading "numeric" is specced to mean one (1) digit in ecma402

  • is this a recent change? if so, what's the PR? i couldn't find it.
  • is this how it's always been? if so, how come all the browsers (and MDN) format "numeric" as two (2) digits?
